content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The main target image shows a structure that resembles a simplified humanoid or robot-like figure with:

- A total of 5 building blocks
- 3 distinct layers

### Spatial Relationships:
- Bottom layer: Two tall green rectangular blocks positioned parallel to each other with a gap between them (forming legs)
- Middle layer: A horizontal yellow rectangular block placed on top of the green blocks (forming a body/torso)
- Top layer: An orange cylindrical block placed vertically on top of the yellow block (forming a neck)
- Top-most element: A yellow semi-cylindrical/dome-shaped block on top of the orange cylinder (forming a head)

## Selected Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:

1. Two green vertical rectangular blocks (for the legs) - Block index 2 (used twice)
2. One yellow horizontal rectangular block (for the body) - Block index 7
3. One orange vertical cylindrical block (for the neck) - Block index 10
4. One yellow dome/semi-cylindrical block (for the head) - Block index 12

## Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 2
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 7
    Step4: Move block with index 10
    Step5: Move block with index 12
}
```

This assembly sequence builds the structure from the bottom up, starting with the two leg blocks, then adding the horizontal body, followed by the neck, and finally placing the dome-shaped head on top.
